header_summary: Programmer proposes integrating Taproot Asset Protocol into the existing BOLT channel/invoice format, enabling the holding and transfer of assets within Lightning channels. RFQ negotiation scheme ensures multi-hop payments using Taproot Assets, while BOLT 11 invoice format remains unchanged. RFQ system allows senders to be unaware of recipient's specific asset. Feedback and suggestions are welcomed to improve the protocol. Release of tapd v0.3 nearing, marking a milestone towards mainnet release. Users can send and receive assets on Lightning Network with upcoming lnd v0.17 and tapd v0.3.

recent_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
recent_posts.summary:
- Simple covenants and timeout-trees can improve the scalability of Lightning channels for casual users.
- Incorporating mechanisms like CTV or APO in Bitcoin's consensus rules is suggested.
- Off-chain transactions and covenants can reduce on-chain footprint in the Lightning Network.

recent_posts.title: Parameters in BIP21 URIs
recent_posts.summary:
- BIP 21 defines a URI scheme for making Bitcoin payments easily.
- Bitcoin wallets can parse BIP21 URIs and pre-fill data for sending Bitcoin.
- Allowing multiple parameter specifications in BIP21 URIs may be potentially confusing and exploitable.

recent_posts.title: Compressed Bitcoin Transactions
recent_posts.summary:
- Currently, the system drops the 16 most significant bits when handling non-zero lock time.
- Adding more fields to the process may increase decompression time significantly, which is undesirable.
- Tom suggests grinding the block height instead of the lock time to save space.

recent_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the implementation of security measures in a Hardware Security Module (HSM) for creating runes.
- Christian and Bastien agree that creating runes in the HSM will have the same security model.
- The decision is between Bolt 8 and rune management, with a preference for Bolt 8.

recent_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
recent_posts.summary:
- To scale Lightning in a trust-free manner, simple covenants are proposed for creating channels.
- The addition of CheckTemplateVerify (CTV) and AnyPrevOut (APO) would improve Lightning's scalability.
- Timeout-trees enable off-chain Lightning channels for casual users without complex coordination or signatures.

recent_posts.title: blip-0029: Taproot Asset Protocol Channels
recent_posts.summary:
- A programmer has published a draft bLIP that maps Taproot Asset Protocol onto BOLT format.
- RFQ negotiation scheme enables multi-hop payments using Taproot Assets edge liquidity.
- The release of tapd v0.3 brings functionality to send and receive assets on Lightning Network.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains maintains server privacy.
- Key and nonce aggregation is performed by Party 2 in the blinded statechains model.
- Party 1 never learns the final signature or message in the blinding process.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Storage for blockchain is limited, but a 5TB hard drive can last for 21 years.
- Costs for hardware decrease over time, reducing the burden of storage expenses.
- Optimization efforts are underway to reduce the space required by individual nodes.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The proposal includes a revised and improved implementation with details and functional tests.
- The new opcode, OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY, enhances the generality of MATT with just two opcodes.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary: - The proposal suggests a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed, addressing channel backup issues.  - It introduces a new type of channel funding transaction with fraud proof acceptance.  - The proposal discusses asymmetric roles, state verification, and bandwidth optimization in lightning channels.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard is proposing to organize the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- He acknowledges the complexities and invites objections or feedback for transparency.
- Antoine suggests surveying stable countries like Algeria, Ghana, Senegal, and Nigeria for hosting.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We are proceeding with the plan discussed at the summit for HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking.
- The plan includes collecting forwarding data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing reputation algorithms.
- Privacy is prioritized and node operators are encouraged to participate in data collection.
